summary: Some federal contracts require that contractors make goals to subcontract at least part of the work to small businesses. If a contractor doesn't make a good faith effort to meet these goals, it could face penalties. Most agencies we reviewed don't report agency-level data on whether contractors are meeting their small business goals—making it hard to know the extent that contractors are complying in good...
title: Small Business Subcontracting: Some Contracting Officers Face Challenges Assessing Compliance with the Good Faith Standard
